rows.name: Ghostly Voices
rows.description: Everyone within Willpower yards hears darkly seductive whispering of voices emanating from the Realm of Chaos. All sentient creatures must pass an Average (+0) Cool Test or gain 1 Corruption point.

rows.name: Hexeyes
rows.description: Your eyes turn an unnatural colour associated with your Lore for 1d10 hours. While your eyes are discoloured, you have 1 Blinded Condition that cannot be resolved by any means.

rows.name: Aethyric Shock
rows.description: You suffer 1d10 wounds, ignoring your Toughness Bonus and Armour Points. Pass an Average (+20) Endurance Test, or also gain a Stunned Condition.

rows.name: Death Walker
rows.description: Your footsteps leave death in their wake. For the next 1d10 hours, any plant life near you withers and dies.

rows.name: Intestinal Rebellion
rows.description: Your bowels move uncontrollably, and you soil yourself. Gain 1 Fatigued Condition, which cannot be removed until you can change your clothes and clean yourself up.

rows.name: Soulfire
rows.description: Gain an Ablaze Condition, as you are wreathed in unholy flames with a colour associated with your Lore.

rows.name: Speak in Tongues
rows.description: You gabble unintelligibly for 1d10 rounds. During this time, you cannot communicate verbally, or make any Casting Tests, although you may otherwise act normally.

rows.name: Swarmed
rows.description: You are engaged by a swarm of aethyric Rats, Giant Spiders, Snakes, or similar (GM's choice). Use the standard profiles for the relevant creature type, adding the Swarm Creature Trait. After 1d10 rounds, if not yet destroyed, the swarm retreats.

rows.name: Ragdoll
rows.description: You are flung 1d10 yards through the air in a random direction, taking 1d10 wounds on landing, ignoring Armour Points, and receiving the Prone Condition.

rows.name: Limb Frozen
rows.description: One limb (randomly determined) is frozen in place for 1d10 hours. The limb is useless, as if it had been Amputated.

rows.name: Darkling Sight
rows.description: You lose the benefit of the Second Sight Talent for 1d10 hours. Channelling Tests also suffer a penalty of -20 for the duration.

rows.name: Chaotic Foresight
rows.description: Gain a bonus pool of 1d10 Fortune points (this may take you beyond your natural limit). Every time you spend one of these points, gain 1 Corruption point. Any of these points remaining at the end of the session are lost.

rows.name: Levititation
rows.description: You are borne aloft on the Winds of Magic, floating 1d10 yards above the ground for 1d10 minutes. Other characters may forcibly move you, and you may move using spells, wings or similar, but will continually return to your levitating position if otherwise left alone. Refer to the Falling rules (see page 166) for what happens when Levitation ends.

rows.name: Regurgitation
rows.description: You spew uncontrollably, throwing up far more foul-smelling vomitus than your body can possibly contain. Gain the Stunned Condition, which lasts for 1d10 Rounds.

rows.name: Chaos Quake
rows.description: All creatures within 1d100 yards must pass an Average (+0) Athletics Test or gain the Prone Condition.

rows.name: Traitor's Heart
rows.description: The Dark Gods entice you to commit horrendous perfidy. Should you attack or otherwise betray an ally to the full extent of your capabilities, regain all Fortune points. If you cause another character to lose a Fate Point, gain +1 Fate Point.

rows.name: Foul Enfeeblement
rows.description: Gain 1 Corruption point, the Prone Condition, and a Fatigued Condition

rows.name: Hellish Stench
rows.description: You now smell really bad! You gain the Distracting Creature Trait (see page 339), and probably the enmity of anyone with a sense of smell. This lasts for 1d10 hours.

rows.name: Power Drain
rows.description: You are unable to use the Talent used to cast the spell (usually Arcane Magic , though it could be Chaos Magic , or a similar Talent), for 1d10 minutes.

rows.name: Aethyric Feedback
rows.description: Everyone within a number of yards equal to your Willpower Bonus — friend and foe alike — suffers 1d10 wounds, ignoring Toughness Bonus and Armour Points, and receives the Prone Condition. If there are no targets in range, the magic has nowhere to vent, so your head explodes, killing you instantly.
